page.title: 01PART OF THE NADDER VALLEY
page.content: Area comprises farmland and woodland with chalk and greensand soils. Divided by the River Nadder running East/West it embraces two villages - Dinton to North. Compton Chamberlayne to South. Dinton: Population 500. 13th Century Church within Chalke Deanery. Catholic Mass Centre. Philipps House - Neo-Classical house used as conference centre. Village and Church built around triangular green. About half population retired. R.A.F. Stores Depot employs much of local labour. Cricket Club. Fottball Club. O.A.P's Club. Compton Chamberlayne: Population 90. 15th Century Church. Village and estate owned by London Businessman (residing in Compton Park), with exception of 16 dwellings and Manor Farm. Most villagers employed by
